election_record.label: Massachusetts 1822 House of Representatives, Boston

overview.note: "The following statement of the votes in this city, yesterday, for the choice of Representatives to the General Court is copied from the official records of the City Clerk. The number of Representatives voted for was twenty-five. The whole number of votes in the respective Wards, was 2889 - of which 1445 were necessary to constitute a choice. Only seventeen are elected and they were borne on the Federal Ticket." Columbian Centinel (Boston, MA). May 11, 1822.
"Two tickets were voted for, one the regular Federal ticket, and the other called the Middling Interest ticket, consisting principally of Federalist." The Repertory (Boston, MA). May 9, 1822.
The Boston Weekly Messenger (Boston, MA) and The Repertory (Boston, MA) list George W. Brimer with 2631 votes but the Ward totals add up to 2731.
The Boston Weekly Messenger (Boston, MA) and The Repertory (Boston, MA) list Nathan Appleton with 1443 votes but the Ward totals add up to 1442.
The Boston Weekly Messenger (Boston, MA) and The Repertory (Boston, MA) list Robert G. Shaw with 1284 votes but the Ward totals add up to 1234.
The Boston Weekly Messenger (Boston, MA) and The Repertory (Boston, MA) list Nathaniel Green with 1073 votes but the Ward totals add up to 973.

election_record.reference: American Statesman and Evening Advertiser (Boston, MA). May 9, 1822.
New-England Palladium and Commercial Advertiser (Boston, MA). May 10, 1822.
The Boston Weekly Messenger (Boston, MA). May 16, 1822.
